intro: Synarmosepalum, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in a variety of colors. Its flowers are typically tubular and have five petals that are fused at the base, a feature known as synandry. Synarmosepalum is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Andean medicine for centuries.
